    Create an aggregation map for continent aggregation

    continent_aggregation_map.Rd

    An aggregation map is a named list. Names are the continents. List items are 3-letter country codes.

    Usage

    continent_aggregation_map(
  exemplar_table_path,
  exemplar_table_tab = "exemplar_table",
  region_code = "Region.code",
  continent = "Continent",
  country = IEATools::iea_cols$country,
  year = IEATools::iea_cols$year
)

    Arguments

    exemplar_table_path

    The path to the exemplar table

    exemplar_table_tab

    The name of the tab in the file at exemplar_table_path where the region information exists. Default is "exemplar_table".

    region_code

    The name of a column containing region codes. Default is "Region.code".

    continent

    The name of the continent column. Default is "Continent".

    country

    The name of the country column in the outgoing data frame. Default is Recca::psut_cols$country.

    year

    The name of the year column in the outgoing data frame. Default is Recca::psut_cols$year.

    Value

    A continent aggregation map.

    Details

    The exemplar table is assumed to be an Excel file with the following columns: region_code and years (as numbers). The body of the table should contain 3-letter codes of countries. The exemplar table is assumed to be on the exemplar_table_tab tab of the Excel file.
